H0.text: In April 2010, ash from the eruption of which mountain caused flights to be cancelled in Northern Europe . Katla

H1.text: In April 2010, ash from the eruption of which mountain caused flights to be cancelled in Northern Europe . Hekla

H2.text: In April 2010, ash from the eruption of which mountain caused flights to be cancelled in Northern Europe . Mount St. Helens

H3.text: In April 2010, ash from the eruption of which mountain caused flights to be cancelled in Northern Europe . Eyjafjallajkull

A4.text: This second eruption threw volcanic ash several kilometres up in the atmosphere, which led to air travel disruption in northwest Europe for six days from 15 to 21 April 2010.

A5.text: This disruption affected over 20 countries and as many as 10 million air travelers.
